long: Meaning: to "stun" (or intransitively, "grow numb"), i.e. "devastate" or (figuratively) "stupefy" (both usually in a passive sense).  Usage: make amazed, be astonied, (be an) astonish(-ment), (be, bring into, unto, lay, lie, make) desolate(-ion, places), be destitute, destroy (self), (lay, lie, make) waste, wonder.  Source: a primitive root;
